security_audit.summary: Scanned 1 text file with instructional content only. No code execution, network calls, or sensitive file access patterns were found.

content.value_statement: You need a reliable workflow for Clojure and ClojureScript work. This skill guides REPL-driven development, evaluation steps, and editing rules.
actual_capabilities: Explains a bottom-up REPL-driven development loop
Provides a namespace evaluation command example
Defines editing rules for readability and formatting
limitations: Does not run code or tests by itself
Relies on external tools like clojure-mcp or ./bin/mage
Does not define project-specific requirements or schemas
Cannot validate runtime behavior without a REPL session

use_cases.title: Refactor with confidence
use_cases.description: Apply a structured REPL-driven approach to refactor Clojure code safely.

use_cases.title: Improve code quality
use_cases.description: Follow best practices and editing rules for consistent ClojureScript changes.

use_cases.title: Standardize workflows
use_cases.description: Adopt a shared development loop and evaluation steps across the team.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new function
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through writing and testing a small Clojure function in the REPL, then integrating it into the namespace.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate a namespace
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the steps to evaluate a Clojure namespace and verify functions with sample inputs.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor safely
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me refactor this Clojure function using small steps and REPL checks at each stage.

prompt_templates.title: Compose features
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan a bottom-up build of a feature using small Clojure functions and REPL validation.

output_examples.input: Help me add a small helper function and test it in the REPL
output: Define the helper function with a clear, small purpose
Evaluate the namespace in the REPL
Call the function with normal and edge inputs
Move the working code into the source file
Re-check readability rules after the edit

best_practices: Test each small function in the REPL before composing
Evaluate namespaces after each meaningful change
Keep edits aligned and files ending with a newline
anti_patterns: Skipping REPL checks and composing untested functions
Making large changes without incremental validation

faq.question: Is this compatible with both Clojure and ClojureScript?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance covers both Clojure and ClojureScript workflows.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and cannot execute or validate code without your tools.

faq.question: Can it integrate with clojure-mcp tools?
faq.answer: Yes. It prefers clojure-mcp tools when they are available.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill text contains no data access or storage behavior.

faq.question: What if namespace evaluation fails?
faq.answer: Check the namespace name and load errors, then re-evaluate in the REPL.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic coding skills?
faq.answer: It focuses on REPL-driven Clojure practices and specific editing rules.
